caption: Figure 2: Overview of the Code-as-Intermediary Translation (CIT) method for synthesizing multimodal instruction data. The process begins with 33 seed codes and generates plot codes across various chart types, topics, and complexity levels through the Self-Instruct and Evol-Instruct stages. The chart set and instruction set are constructed bi-directionally, and the final filtered data yields REACHQA, a dataset for distilling visual chart reasoning abilities from LLMs to MLLMs.
description: The figure illustrates the Code-as-Intermediary Translation (CIT) method used to create the REACHQA dataset, showing how seed codes are expanded, charts are generated, and instructions are created and filtered.
